item.title: Missile Command Delta adds Xbox Series and Xbox One versions, launches July 8
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/05/missile-command-delta-adds-xbox-series-and-xbox-one-versions-launches-july-8

Missile Command Delta, a reimagining of Atari‘s 1980s missile defense arcade classic as a turn-based tactical game, will launch for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Xbox One, Switch, and PC via Steam on July 18, publisher Atari and developers Mighty Yell and 13AM Games announced. The Xbox versions are newly announced.

Here is an overview of the game, via Atari:

About

Missiles are incoming. The stakes are high. Only you can stop the destruction. The teams at Mighty Yell and 13AM Games have taken one of Atari’s most iconic titles and created a high-pressure, tactical turn-based game where players must manage their pool of defenses strategically to survive rounds of incoming missiles.

Missile Command Delta approaches gameplay in a completely new way, but it retains all the tension and suspense of the arcade original. You have to think strategically about every move you make because even one poor choice can have grave consequences. The turn-based strategy game is wrapped in a twisting, narrative thriller—great for mystery fans, completionists, and players that love to explore and solve puzzles.

Between inbound missile alerts, investigate the underground bunker to access locked rooms, uncover secrets, and strengthen your arsenal. Will you be able to unravel the mystery in time?

Key Features

  • Turn-Based Strategy – A totally unique strategy experience. New missile and enemy types are uncovered when you explore deeper into the bunker.
  • Plan Your Defense – Every turn is critical, and one poor choice can spell disaster. Plan your next move, and map out a cascade of explosions that take out multiple enemy missiles to help conserve your resources.
  • High-Stakes Mystery – The turn-based strategy game is wrapped in a high-stakes narrative puzzle. Read every document, watch your every step, and ace every puzzle if you want to [REDACTED].
  • Experience the Cold War – A claustrophobic retro-future aesthetic of dusty command consoles and supercomputers place you deep into Cold War paranoia.

Watch a new trailer below.

Release Date Trailer

item.title: Indie JRPGs showcase Indie Quest 2025 set for May 29
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/05/indie-jrpgs-showcase-indie-quest-2025-set-for-may-29

Includes "must-see world premiere from a critically-acclaimed studio."

YouTube channel The Gaming Shelf has announced Indie Quest 2025, a new showcase spotlighting independently developed JRPGs. It will premiere on YouTube on May 29 at 4:00 p.m. PT / 7:00 p.m. ET.

The broadcast will feature over 40 exclusive game trailers, a “must-see world premiere from a critically-acclaimed studio,” and popular YouTube creators introducing each game.

“From tactical throwbacks to inventive turn-based experiments, Indie Quest celebrates the full spectrum of what modern Indie JRPGs can be,” reads the announcement. “Whether you’re a fan of pixel art nostalgia or boundary-pushing new mechanics, this showcase promises something for every RPG enthusiast—and some new surprises along the way.”

Watch a teaser trailer below.

Teaser Trailer

item.title: RAIDOU Remastered: The Mystery of the Soulless Army ‘The Principles of RAIDOU Episode 1’ trailer
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/05/raidou-remastered-the-mystery-of-the-soulless-army-the-principles-of-raidou-episode-1-trailer

  • PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Switch 2
  • Xbox Series

The world of the Taisho era capital and ally demons.

ATLUS has released a new trailer for RAIDOU Remastered: The Mystery of the Soulless Army, introducing the world of the 20th year of the Taisho era, the time in which Raidou lives, as well as the “Demons allies” who fight alongside him.

RAIDOU Remastered: The Mystery of the Soulless Army is due out for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch 2, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Switch, and PC via Steam on June 19. Read more about the game here, here, and here.

Watch the trailer below.

The Principles of RAIDOU: The World of the Taisho Era Capital and Ally Demons

English

Japanese
